long: Meaning: "near", "with" or "among"; often in general, "to".  Usage: about, according to, after, against, among, as for, at, because(-fore, -side), both...and, by, concerning, for, from, × hath, in(-to), near, (out) of, over, through, to(-ward), under, unto, upon, whether, with(-in).  Source: (but only used in the shortened constructive form "אֶל" ); a primitive particle; properly, denoting motion "towards", but occasionally used of a quiescent position, i.e.
